Yes! According to Scientology screwball Sharron Angle that's true!
 
Sharron Angle may be giving the press the silent treatment now, but she hasn't always been so tight-lipped. Think Progress (via Alternet) has dug up some eyebrow-raising audio of a radio interview the Nevada Senate candidate did with Bill Manders back in January. The subject: abortion. Her stance: disgusting.
 
 Manders asks her whether there is "any reason at all for an abortion," and she answers: "Not in my book." For clarity, he says: "So, in other words, rape and incest would not be something?" And Angle replies with this reasoning: "You know, I'm a Christian, and I believe that God has a plan and a purpose for each one of our lives and that he can intercede in all kinds of situations and we need to have a little faith in many things." You see, God planned your rape and pregnancy. Isn't that reassuring?

 Sharron Angle: God planned your rape, don't abort! - Broadsheet - Salon.com
 
 Nutcase Angle of Nevada is running again Senator Majority Leader Harry Reid in this fall's election.
 
 The question is, are there enough screwballs and nutcases in Nevada to elect her?

 I think the examples that you provided are too turgid and emotional for a realistic view of abortion.
 Most abortions are provided to pregnant women who do not want a baby because of financial or social reasons not because the pregnant woman was raped.
 A far more common scenario is a woman who's contraception has failed and she simply feels that she is not ready for motherhood or having more children.
 Abortion is a cynical and brutal solution to the problem of an unwanted child.
 Many pro choicers try to counteract this by dehumanising the fetus.
 Every abortion is a failure, it is a termination of the potential of a human being..not just ridding the mother of a problem.
 
 However, in a secular society there should be a provision to rid a mother of her unborn child provided the fetus is not developed enough to feel pain or fear...
 I believe everyone has the right to their own road to hell.
 
 Yes I am against rape.
 I am also against torture and death.
 I will give you two guesses to tell me what fate I would choose out of the two...

While I am politically pro-choice, I am pro-life for myself. I believe in small government, and the ability to make choices.
 
 My oldest child was conceived from rape. It happened soon before I was to leave for pre-med. I chose to have my son and raise him. I'd rather not discuss it farther, but that was my choice to make, and I'm glad that I made the choice I did.

Veiled, I hope you will discuss your personal situation further.
 
 You are protected, I'd presume, by the anonymity of the net.
 
 I'd like to know if you were able to pursue your career goals despite your forced pregnancy -- and if you were able to support yourself and your new responsibility at a reasonable level, being able to live in decent housing, having enough food, clothing, the ability to educate your child, et al.

It had a serious impact upon my life, and I had to change my career goals. I struggled, and needed the help of my family for quite a while. I also suffered from depression. Thankfully, I was able to pull myself out of that situation, but it's not something I would wish upon anyone.
 
 I will never judge a woman for making a different choice. I know precisely how being in that situation feels, and I fully understand why many choose to end the pregnancy.

I respect your decision, especially because of your stance that what you chose should not be forced upon anyone else.
 
 I wish that we did not live in a society which penalized women with children so much. 
 
 In more advanced industrial nations, like those of continental Europe, you would have been able to have childcare and the security to pursue your career goals. We have the misfortune to live in a very backward and barbaric nation which values warfare above all else.
 
 Women and children can go to hell! But we can sure pour money into the war moachine.

Women and children can go to hell! But we can sure pour money into the war moachine.

 
 Oh, you'd rather speak Farsi and wear a Burkha?
 
 You liberal Kool Aid drinkers have no concept of what evil is or how to deal with it.
 
 You know, I really loved that one comment from that Williams guy I once referenced, which read:
 
 "Their (the liberal's) inability to grasp the obvious leads them into that corner every time and once there, once diplomacy has run its course without results, they are out of business." 
 
 In other words, "After the appeasing liberals are done with their seemingly endless, hot-air, wind-jamming sessions at the inept and corrupt U.N. - after clinging desperately to the coat tails of Jacques Chirac and Rosie O'Donnell; after all their sophomoric Jane Fonda and Cindy Sheehan surrender rallies and Neville Chamberlain pseudo-peace ploys; and with the bad guys still refusing to budge one iota - they're done. Finis. Game over. That's all there is from the libs, there isn't any more. Not even a lethal dose of Viagra can possibly get them to stand up now. All that’s left for them is to go home, wring their hands, and wait for the WMD’s to come crashing down on their Greenpeace-utopian fantasyland. 
 
 And, besides their godless infanticide against the innocent unborn, that's why liberals are dangerous.

Burkha's are cool, man. id wear one with a silk screened picture of Muhammed on it. and a kool-aid dispensing hat, of course.
 
 that would be awesome.
